column4: Hey guys, in related news, gcc 4.0 is out and it's supposed to give C++ a 40% performance boost.  Good for you kde users I suppose ;)
Also there are some optimizations that are supposed to speed up C as well -- so you may even notice a difference in gnome.
wtf are you talking about...  sorry for roughness.
what is the connection between file size and the performance ?
GCC 4.0 is out.  It has great optimizations for C++.  This translates into a faster KDE.
Boot times?  KDE does take a little while to boot.
it is fine.. just don't through such excessive numbers
I said 40% smaller libraries :P that's not a made-up number
Hey guys, in related news, gcc 4.0 is out and it's supposed to give C++ a 40% performance boost.  Good for you kde users I suppose ;)
Err, sorry, the filesize will be 40% smaller
if all the system is built upon this gcc. can it link with older libs ?
Supposedly.  I compiled a few programs with GCC4 and had no problems with the old libraries.  But by no means did I test this extensively.
you know what major ver. number change in gcc means to the system ?
mjr:  You guys should check out #ubuntu-motu, those guys in there have more experience compiling with GCC4.  They've been doing it for about a month now.
It's a requirement, you know, since breezy will be 100% gcc4 from what I've heard ;)
